column1: #Text=Nigerian fuel tanker explosion leaves at least 30 dead
#Text=A fuel tanker explosion in Nigeria has left at least 30 dead .
#Text=The disaster occurred near a busy bus station in Port Harcourt .
#Text=Port Harcourt is located in an oil rich area , and is the central point of the Nigerian oil industry , which has a value of billions of US Dollars .
#Text=It is consequently a regular target for extremists , but a police spokesman said terrorism is not believed to be a factor .
#Text=According to CNN , the same spokesman said a car 's driver lost control whilst being chased by police , striking the tanker and triggering the explosion .

#Text=However , AFP reports that the tanker itself was being chased for carrying stolen petrol , and said the vehicle overturned after hitting a barricade on a partially constructed section of road in a bid to escape .
#Text=The Associated Press ( AP ) makes no mention of a police chase , and says the lorry overturned after suffering a blowout .
#Text=The crash occurred at a major junction in Eleme district .
#Text=Fuel was spilled over cars and shop entrances before igniting .
#Text=Local shop owner Matthew Eliagwu described the disaster to AP : " I heard a loud bang and I came out of my shop .
